poem:
Title: Commerce in Verse

profits rise with the sun 
but observe the warning sirens
- they sing in hushed whispers
our shoes glisten, yet pockets empty
beating hearts trade bricks for dreams
credit cards echo our hunger for more
see, we are all balancing on this tightrope
of desire and disaster
crawling and falling in and out of debt-
this is our dance with capitalism
